Package scenegraph

Class TriangleMesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • scenegraph.AbstSceneObject
      • scenegraph.AbstNode
        • scenegraph.AbstSpatial
          • scenegraph.AbstGeometry
            • scenegraph.TriangleMesh
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, ChannelInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Cube, Sphere
    public class TriangleMesh
extends AbstGeometry
    Class provides storage and management for triangle meshes. The class needs a MeshData object to operate on the vertex data. Other functions, such as face and vertex normal calculations, are done by the triangle mesh.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ulla

      • TriangleMesh

        public TriangleMesh​(AbstMeshData mesh,
                    int[] triangleIndices,
                    Vec3Array vertexNormals,
                    Vec3Array UV)
        Constructor assigns the given arrays as references.
        Parameters:
        mesh - vertex information
        triangleIndices - vertex indices to form triangles
        vertexNormals - vertex normals (if == null, they will be calculated)
        UV - texture coordinates

      • updateNormals

        public void updateNormals()
        Update the normal vectors after mesh deformation. All face and face vertex normals are updated.

      • calcVertexNormals

        public void calcVertexNormals()
        Update the normal vectors after mesh deformation. All face and face vertex normals are updated.

      • updateWorldData

        public boolean updateWorldData()
        If the object is not hidden, an update of the mesh data is requested (e.g. a deforming/morphing of the mesh data after an update of the morphing weights). If the update request returns that it has updated its data, the face normals are recalculated.
        Overrides:
        updateWorldData in class AbstNode
